page.title: 02INDUSTRY PETROCHEMICALS
page.content: Crude oil from the North Sea is split into a range of products. Some are processed further by other local plants to produce finished products. Others leave Teesside as partly refined petrochemicals.( See By-products) The chemical method is called fractioning. It involves heating to drive off and collect the various grades of hydrocarbons.(see Processes) Methane, butane and propane are stored in spheres as liquid petroleum gas (L.P.G.) USES L.P.G. bottle gas and lighter fuel Naptha petrol Kerosene lighting and heating homes Heavy oil diesel fuel Paraffin candle wax, polish Bitumen roads, roofs,refining.
